definition: to go to market/to go to a fair
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Thursday is market day in poitiers.
sentences.chinese: 星期四是普瓦捷的赶集日。

sentences.english: In autumn, the cattle have to be rounded up and counted.
sentences.chinese: 秋天得把牛群赶集起来，进行清点。

sentences.english: The donkey helped them pull the field plow during sowing season and carry them to the market.
sentences.chinese: 这头驴平时帮他们种地拉磨，赶集时还要作脚力。

sentences.english: One day as he was driving home from the market, he dropped his knife.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他驾驭着马车从家去赶集，他掉了他的刀。

sentences.english: The market, meet the rabbit elder brother often do.
sentences.chinese: 赶集办年货，遇见兔大哥。

sentences.english: Going to the market and drinking a bowl of sheep's haslet soup also is an enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 赶集时喝碗羊杂割汤也算是改善了一回口味。

sentences.english: We walked down the village street， where they were having market day.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着村里的大街向前走去，村民们正在那里赶集。

sentences.english: Netease Forum, outside the chain, people networks, 58 city, go to the market net.
sentences.chinese: 有网易论坛的外链，百姓网，58同城，赶集网等。

sentences.english: "Let's go to the fair, Matt, " his wife said.
The town's always busy on market day .
sentences.chinese: 小镇在赶集那天总是热闹非凡。

sentences.english: The Bai zest for business in even more obvious at the great market day scenes in Dali, Wase and Shaping.
sentences.chinese: 到了赶集的日子，白族风味的商业气息更加浓烈。

sentences.english: This was market-day, and Mrs Joe was out on one of these expeditions.
sentences.chinese: 今天就是赶集的日子，乔夫人便去帮他忙了。

sentences.english: On a wagon bound for market There's a calf with a mournful eye .
sentences.chinese: 一辆颠簸赶集的马车上一只小牛目露哀伤。

sentences.english: On Saturday evenings when my aunt went marketing I had to go to carry some of the parcels.
sentences.chinese: 每周六晚舅妈去赶集，我总要陪着提包。

sentences.english: My purse was stolen in the fair.
sentences.chinese: 我的钱包在赶集时被人偷走了。

sentences.english: Today is Thursday and it's market day in Aix.
sentences.chinese: 今天是星期四，是艾克斯市的赶集日。

definition: to set up a stall/to maintain a large staff and organization
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
to shop in preparation for Chinese New Year
to go from village to village (like an itinerant artist)
merchandise sold for Chinese New Year
